realtimeweb.businesssearch.main

Class BusinessQuery

  • Object
    • realtimeweb.businesssearch.main.BusinessQuery

  • public class BusinessQuery
extends Object
    A query object used to make a search for businesses. A BusinessQuery is built-up by chaining together filters.
    For example:

    BusinessQuery myQuery = BusinessQuery("Blacksburg, VA");
    myQuery.limitRadius(100).filterCategories("restaurants").sortBy(SortMode.DISTANCE);

    ... will create a query that will search for restaurants within 100 meters of Blacksburg, and sort the results by Distance. If you wish to remove a filter after it's been added, you can do so easily:

    myQuery.removeRadiusLimit().removeCategoriesFilter();

    ... will change the query to search all around Blacksburg for any businesses. and just sort the results.
    Author:
    acbart

        public BusinessQuery(String location)
        Create a new BusinessQuery that will search around the location. The Location should be a string representing a named area, e.g. "Blacksburg, VA 24060".
        Parameters:
        location -

      • limitRadius

        public BusinessQuery limitRadius(int radius)
        Limit the radius of this query. Results will only be returned if they are within radius meters of the given location. If the value is too large, an AreaTooLargeException error may be returned. The max value is 40000 meters (25 miles).
        Parameters:
        radius - The distance in meters
        Returns:
        This BusinessQuery instance, allowing you to chain together other filters.

      • removeRadiusLimit

        public BusinessQuery removeRadiusLimit()
        Removes the radius limit filter, so results will be returned regardless of their distance from the location.
        Returns:
        This BusinessQuery instance, allowing you to chain together other filters.

      • filterCategories

        public BusinessQuery filterCategories(BusinessCategory... categories)
        Filters the results by categories, returning only results that fall into the given categories. BusinessCategories can be found via the getCategories method. An arbitrary number of categories can be included. You can also search via the category's alias by passing in Strings, but you cannot mix BusinessCategories and Strings.
        Parameters:
        categories -
        Returns:
        This BusinessQuery instance, allowing you to chain together other filters.

      • filterCategories

        public BusinessQuery filterCategories(String... categories)
        Filters the results by categories given by their alias (e.g. General Dentistry would be "generaldentistry") - so only results that businesses that are in the category will be returned. An arbitrary number of aliases can be given. A complete list of all the categories and their aliases is at http://www.yelp.com/developers/documentation/all_category_list.
        Parameters:
        categories -
        Returns:
        This BusinessQuery instance, allowing you to chain together other filters.

      • removeCategoriesFilter

        public BusinessQuery removeCategoriesFilter()
        Remove any categories that are being filtered.
        Returns:
        This BusinessQuery instance, allowing you to chain together other filters.

      • paginate

        public BusinessQuery paginate(int offset,
                     int limit)
